Class LevelOne

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
Levels.LevelParent
Levels.LevelOne
public class LevelOne extends LevelParent
Represents the first level of the game. Handles spawning enemies, checking game-over conditions, and advancing to the next level.

  • Field Details

    • BACKGROUND_IMAGE_NAME

      private static final String BACKGROUND_IMAGE_NAME
      Path to the background image for the level. Specifies the file location of the background image resource.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NEXT_LEVEL

      private static final String NEXT_LEVEL
      The name of the next level to transition to after completing the current level. Used to dynamically load the next level.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TOTAL_ENEMIES

      private static final int TOTAL_ENEMIES
      The maximum number of enemies allowed to exist in the level at any given time. This value caps the number of enemies spawned concurrently.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • KILLS_TO_ADVANCE

      private static final int KILLS_TO_ADVANCE
      The number of kills required to advance to the next level. Players must achieve this target to progress in the game.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ENEMY_SPAWN_PROBABILITY

      private static final double ENEMY_SPAWN_PROBABILITY
      The probability of spawning a new enemy during each game update cycle. Determines the likelihood of enemy planes appearing on the screen.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PLAYER_INITIAL_HEALTH

      private static final int PLAYER_INITIAL_HEALTH
      The initial health of the player's plane at the start of the level. Represents the total health points available to the player at the beginning of the game.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • killProgressBar

      private final javafx.scene.control.ProgressBar killProgressBar
      A progress bar used to visually represent the player's kill progress in the level. The progress bar updates dynamically as the player achieves kills.

    • killProgressText

      private final javafx.scene.text.Text killProgressText
      A text element used to display detailed progress information for the player's kills. Shows the current number of kills compared to the target number of kills required to advance.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelOne

      public LevelOne(double screenHeight, double screenWidth)
      Constructs a LevelOne instance.
      Parameters:
      screenHeight - the height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - the width of the game screen.

  • Method Details

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over or if the user has reached the kill target to advance to the next level. If the player's plane is destroyed, the game ends. If the player has achieved the required kills, the level advances.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class LevelParent

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes friendly units, specifically the user's plane, and adds it to the game root.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy planes in the game. The total number of enemies is capped at a predefined limit. Each enemy's spawn probability is determined by a random chance.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates the LevelView for this level, setting the initial player's health display.
      Specified by:
      instantiateLevelView in class LevelParent
      Returns:
      the LevelView instance for this level.

    • userHasReachedKillTarget

      public boolean userHasReachedKillTarget()
      Determines whether the user has achieved the required number of kills to advance to the next level.
      Returns:
      true if the player's kill count has reached or exceeded the target; false otherwise.

    • updateKillProgress

      private void updateKillProgress()
      Updates the kill progress bar and the corresponding text.
